definition[0]: to give something to a person in authority, especially an illegal weapon or something lost or stolen
example[0]: The rebels were told to turn in their weapons and ammunition.
example[1]: My wallet was turned in to the police two days later.
definition[1]: to give back something you have borrowed or rented
example[2]: When do the library books have to be turned in?
definition[2]: to produce a particular profit, result etc
example[3]: Bimec turned in net profits of £2.4 million.
example[4]: Last night the team turned in another dazzling performance.
definition[3]: to tell the police who or where a criminal is
example[5]: Margrove’s wife finally turned him in.
example[6]: I think I’ll turn in early tonight.
definition[5]: to give a piece of work you have done to a teacher, your employer etc
example[7]: Have you all turned in your homework assignments?
